com.gsma.mobileconnect.r2.cache
Class AbstractCache

java.lang.Object
  com.gsma.mobileconnect.r2.cache.AbstractCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICache
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConcurrentCache
public abstract class AbstractCache
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICache

Base class for Discovery Caches that implements basic cache control mechanisms and type casting reducing the amount of implementation needed in each derived cache class.

Since:
2.0

AbstractCache

protected AbstractCache(IJsonService jsonService,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractCacheable>,Tuple<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long>> cacheExpiryLimits)
Construct an instance of this discovery cache, setting the executor service to use for concurrent operations.

Parameters:
jsonService - used to serialise and deserilise objects.
cacheExpiryLimits - map defining limits for which types may be cached.

get

public <T extends AbstractCacheable> T get(java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
                                throws CacheAccessException
Description copied from interface: ICache
Return a cached value based on the key. If it is found to be setExpired it will be removed from the cache.

Equivalent to calling: 

     cache.get(key, true);

Specified by:
get in interface ICache
Type Parameters:
T - the type to be returned from the cache.
Parameters:
key - to match (required).
clazz - the type of object to return.
Returns:
the cached value if present, null otherwise.
Throws:
CacheAccessException - on failure to fetch.

                                           java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                           boolean removeIfExpired)
                                throws CacheAccessException
Description copied from interface: ICache
Return a cached value based on the key.

Specified by:
get in interface ICache
Type Parameters:
T - the type to be returned from the cache.
Parameters:
key - to match (required).
clazz - the type of object to return.
removeIfExpired - If value should be removed if it is retrieved and found to be setExpired, should be set to false if a fallback value is required for if the next call for the required resource fails.
Returns:
the cached value if present, null otherwise
Throws:
CacheAccessException - on failure to fetch.

Parameters:
